section: Client acknowledges and agrees that all due dates set forth in the Scope of Work are guaranteed by the Company, regardless of whether the company receives required materials, documentation, or approvals in a timely fashion from the client. Delays will not affect the due dates.
explanation: This statement is illogical and creates an internal contradiction. It asserts that the Company guarantees due dates regardless of whether they receive necessary materials from the client. This is not possible. If the client delays providing materials, it will inherently affect the company's ability to meet the due dates. The sentence 'Delays will not affect the due dates' directly contradicts the reality of project development.

section: Company is obligated to continue providing Customer Service throughout the duration of this agreement, and may not alter or cease providing Customer Service. Company at its sole discretion may at any time alter or cease providing the Customer Service which it has agreed to provide to Client relating to Client Website pursuant to this Agreement without any liability to Company.
explanation: This section contains contradictory statements regarding the Customer Service. First, it states that the Company is obligated to continue providing Customer Service and may not alter or cease providing it. Then, it immediately contradicts itself by stating that the Company, at its sole discretion, may alter or cease providing Customer Service without any liability. This creates confusion about the company's obligations.

section: Client shall make a prepayment of $1,900 and pay the remaining $3,100 on completion of the Scope of Work. However, the Client can pay the remaining amount at any time, or in multiple installments, before the Scope of Work completion.
explanation: The initial statement outlines that the $3,100 should be paid on completion of the scope of work. However, the follow-up statement makes that obsolete. The client can pay the remaining amount in full at any time, even in multiple installments. This does not make the initial statement valid.
